intro: Conocephalus, commonly known as the clubmoss, is a genus of small, evergreen plants belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. These plants are characterized by their slender, branching stems and small, scale-like leaves. They typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Conocephalus species are often found in the understory of temperate and tropical forests. They play an important role in soil stabilization and provide habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
